New Records: Beier and Aleksandar Pavlović picked up their first caps for Germany.
Germany have now kept clean sheets in two of their previous three matches, having last kept the opposition out in March 2023 before that.
Key Match Events: Mykola Matviienko fired over from close range within five minutes of the match.
İlkay Gündoğan should have scored from the edge of the six-yard box as he mistimed his header from Pascal Groß's cross.
Roman Yaremchuk forced a strong save from Manuel Neuer after Jonathan Tah had been dispossessed.
Maximilian Beier hit the woodwork with his first involvement after coming on around the hour mark.
Chris Führich tested Anatoliy Trubin with a fierce effort before Beier headed wide from Deniz Undav's cross to the back post.
Pre-Game Insights: Julian Nagelsmann was without the likes of Toni Kroos, Antonio Rüdiger, Niclas Füllkrug, and Nico Schlotterbeck following their UEFA Champions League exploits.
Post-Match Reflections: Nagelsmann and his players will now turn their attention to Friday's match with Greece at Borussia-Park, where the head coach will hope to be with his full squad.
Nagelsmann’s record in charge of the national team (all friendly matches) is three wins, two draws and two defeats.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany dominated possession and were increasingly in control as time went by, but they were ultimately unable to find the goal they were looking for.
Germany are now unbeaten in consecutive home matches for the first time in two years.
Thomas Müller now has 129 appearances for Germany, just one short of Lukas Podolski, who occupies third place in the all-time list.
